name: CasaMagna Marriott Cancun Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We moved to the Marriott after a terrible experience at another hotel. The marriott was very nice with freindly employees. After checking out of our other hotel at 10am the Marriott was happy to give us an early check in so we could start our vacation. My only real suggestion is if they are offering the all-inclusive option online I would go with that. We didn't book it, wasn't available the morning of, but would have saved a bunch of money if it would have. Food and drinks aren't cheap at the hotel, so the extra money paid for the all-inclusive makes up for itself quick.
reviews.title: Great Trip

reviews.text: Marriot Casamagna is beautiful and the room itself deserves a high rating, but the service was not the greatest. During my stay, I ran into a few minor problems and needed assistance from the staff. They were all pleasant, but did not go the extra mile and were not proactive. I got the impression that they didn't really care and just wanted me to go away. Receiving mediocre service during travel complications is extremely frustrating. Also, I do not own a laptop and was unpleasantly surprised to find that the hotel does not offer free Internet computers. They have a small business center that does not operate 24-hours a day and charges over 5$ per 10-minute session. Other hotels in the area offer free, 24-hour Internet access. Dining options were also a let down at Casamagna. On my first night, I arrived late and ended up spending over 30USD for an unmemorable sandwich, soft drink, and small dessert from room service. I like having ice in the room and got really tired of having to walk to the bar every day because the ice machine was out of order for the entire week. Before leaving I needed help contacting a taxi service to get to the airport, so I approached the concierge. After a huge hassle and many failed calls, I asked the staff if the hotel offers transfers. It was frustrating to find out that they do offer them and they could have saved me a huge hassle by just mentioning this in the first place. Again, the service at this property is sub par and bordered on passive aggressive. After reading all the fantastic reviews, I was disappointed.
reviews.title: Nice room, but service needs improvement

reviews.text: Our stay at the Casamagna Cancun Resort was wonderful. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The hotel is elegant upon entry and the rooms are comfortable, clean and beautifully decorated with large bathrooms. The color of the huge pool mirrors the turquoise beach, both viewed from our balcony. Service here is truly wonderful. The hotel is conveniently located by a bus stop if you don't want to pay for taxis. I would return in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Beautiful and Friendly

reviews.text: This is a true hidden gem in Cancun. Be careful, it's NOT the JW Marriott next door, it is a small rise hacienda type hotel called the Casa Magna Marriott. Truly fantastic service, excellent food and drinks. Right on the beach. Rooms are spotless and so is the entire hotel.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels ever.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are 5 or 6 different restaurants here to accommodate all tastes and ages. There is a glaze pottery station for kids and parasailing on the beach. We met people coming back here for their 5th and 6th years. It is a really relaxing resort. The pool side service is top notch. The whole hotel is so relaxed and not for the pretentious. They have a great sports bar for fans and an authentic Thai restaurant. It is 10 mins from the airport and just a great find. Enjoy !!
reviews.title: Easy way to go

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked our trip via Marriott's website, using my husband's Marriott Points and when we got there they had upgraded us (as well as our traveling companions) to ocean/pool view and provided us with a complimentary cheese plate and a bucket of beer. Also, both rooms were ready when we arrived early at 1:30 PM. We found the rooms to be neatly decorated and plenty big, with a nice sitting area and a flat screen tv. In room internet was available for somewhere around $15/day, though we never used it.
reviews.title: Another great Marriott Resort

reviews.text: Resort grounds- The pool area was great, though chairs (especially 4 together) were hard to come by after 10:00 am. We ate lunch poolside several times and found the food to be decent. We did venture down to the beach area one day, but did not stay long. As the other reviewers mentioned, the area is very small, you can't get in the water and even after scooting our chairs way back, we still got soaked when the tide came in.
reviews.title: Beautiful but smokey

reviews.text: Dining- We ate at the japanese steak house and thought the food was delicious, though the atmosphere was a little lacking in comparison to others we have been to. We also ate dinner at the steakhouse inside of the hotel and also had excellent food there... though the service was terrible. They also do a breakfast buffet which is not in line with other Marriott's, so was therefor quite overpriced over the quality. We had both lunch and dinner at Champion's Sports Bar and it was fine sportsbar type food & we always had excellent service. We ate outside of the resort a few nights too & our absolute favorite was Perico's. It is well worth the cab ride downtown. The food (mexican) was excellent and very affordable, though the best part was the entertainment. They get you up dancing, conga-lining around the restaurant, there is a midget that brings you shots, the band is entertainment in itself. We are a group of 30 somethings, though there were families and older folks there too that all seemed to be having a great time.
reviews.title: Great Hotel Stay

likes.liked: — Location was the best asset of my accommodation as I sleep a lot on vacation.

reviews.title: Great Vacation
reviews.text: Excursions- We booked a snorkeling trip to Isla Mujeres through the concierge at the hotel. I think that it was somewhere around $75 p/p. It was convenient b/c we only had to walk across the street to the marina to catch the boat. Our #1 tip if you do this trip is to make sure that you get inline for the boat early to get on the top deck!!! We were not so fortunate on the trip over and were soaking wet, freezing, and semi- seasick watching others who were VERY seasick, while we could hear the folks upstairs having a good time- dancing, drinking, sunbathing, etc. The snorkeling was not that great in comparison to other places that we have been, but Isla Mujeres was fun and once we made sure to get a seat up top on the way back, the boatride & crew was much more enjoyable. We also did an excursion to Chichen Itza, though did not book it through the hotel and were quite glad. It was something like $95 p/p through the hotel and we booked ours through a street vendor at the market downtown for around $35 p/p and though I will admit we were skeptical... it was almost exactly the same thing. They came and picked us up at our hotel in the AM & took up to meet the motorcoach, which was very nice & clean. We found out later that other people on our tour had paid $65. The guide was excellent, our lunch was excellent and other than the crowd, we enjoyed the ruins at Chichen Itza.

reviews.title: Perfect Family Getaway!!
reviews.text: Transportation- We mostly took the buses everywhere we went, as you really can't beat the 65 cent fare, though at night we took cabs to dinner as we just didnt feel like hiking down to the bus stop in heels, etc. We arranged our transportation to & from the airport via the hotel and would highly recommend doing so. It was pretty much the same price as a cab, though we were able to pre-arrange it and they right there waiting for us when we were ready to go.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a very good deal for our stay at CasaMagna - pay for 3 nights and get 1 free, so we stayed 8 days in total but only payed for 6. The hotel is not very new, but is well kept and has an authentic Caribbean feel to it, with lovely furniture and spacious rooms. The bathroom looks a bit dated, but everything is clean and tidy, so not a real problem here.
reviews.title: A pleasure to stay here

reviews.text: The best rooms are of course the beachfront ones, the ocean view is breathtaking and well worth the extra dollars. We were initially given a Resort View room, which was located on a side of the hotel and the view was terrible, with a nearby hotel very close. So we decided to get the ocean view, which makes a lot of difference when in a R&R vacation.
reviews.title: Worst hotel I've ever stayed in

reviews.text: We had breakfast included, which was served in the La Capilla Argentinian Restaurant and was truly incredible - wide variety of choices, starting with traditional mexican food to american and even asian style food. You could also ask the chef there for a-la-carte dishes. Although inside, the tables are very close to the pool area, and the ocean can be seen from the restaurant. Service was very attentive and all smiles.
reviews.title: 100x better than Gran Melia

reviews.text: The pool area could be better, though. There is only one pool, which is fairly large and has a cocktail bar, and a jacuzzi tub - all this very close to the beach. The service for the bar was very good and quick, but it was the low-season (early September) so they weren't very busy.
reviews.title: R&R - got what I wanted & needed!
Mexican Mediocrity
reviews.text: All in all, this was a very pleasant stay for us and we would probably come back here if we'd get a great deal like the one i mentioned above.

Just return and loved our hotel. We upgraded to a suite, but my brother had a "normal" oceanview room and loved it also. They replaced all of the pool chairs during our stay and so they are now like the mesh covered ones on the beach. We ate at the hotel's Steak House, Japanese restaurant, Champions and Capilla's for breakfast. Food was all of good quality. No problem with drinking the water at meals. We did rent a refrigerator for $5 day and bought juice, beer etc. to take to the beach in our small cooler. That saved a lot of money - but we still made a point to purchase something from the waitstaff at the pool/beach each day also. We had massages at the JW Marriott and highly recommend Kristina. The Myan massage was great. When you book a treatment you have use of all of the spa facilities for the day - so plan on using them, steam room, suana, whirlpools, exercise room, etc. We had no problem getting chairs at the pool or beach. Although we were up early - it did not seem to get crowded until around 11 AM.
reviews.title: Loved the hotel!
Loved IT
reviews.text: Staff at the hotel was great - David one of the doormen, our maid, etc. We did tip $3-$4/day to the maid and our room was always spotless and cleaned early. Nightly turndown was also completed. Don't forget your coupon book at the airport, there were coupons for 10-20% all of the restaurants at the hotel and those accross the street as well.

reviews.title: WONDERFUL PLACE
reviews.text: My husband and 7 month old daughter just spent 6 days here and loved it! The hotel was very clean and the staff was wonderful and attentive! They were also completely knowledgable on all that the area had to offer.

reviews.title: Loved it!!!!
reviews.text: I would recommend doign the all inclusinve plan though, the hotel drinks were expensive and each time you ordered there was a service charged tacked on. Restuarants were good. We would totally go back.

We returned from Cancun on May 24th and it was awesome. The Marriott Casamagna is the finest hotel that I have every stayed at. The staff are wonderful they will help you out anyway they can. I felt like royalty! The staff were constantly cleaning everything. The beach was very clean hardly no rocks, beautiful sand. The rooms were great I would definantely recommend getting an oceanview. Wonderful views! Me and my fiance give this 4 stars. Our housekeeper Pierre was great. He would always make things with the towels(like swans, fans, etc) pretty neat. Overall excellent,excellent,excellent place. Two thumbs way up!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Casa Magnifique!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my wife got married at this hotel on the 12th of October of last year. We stayed for three nights after and we have nothing but great things to say about hotel and it's staff.
reviews.title: Married at the CasaMagna

likes.liked: — The clean, open atmostphere, and the comfy bed!
likes.disliked: — nothing at all it was perfect!

reviews.text: Hotel: The hotel is very beautiful and classy. It has all the amenities you would want in a great hotel. The pool was very large and not crowded at all. This was the middle of October I might add though, hurricane season. I asked the front desk when we got our room how full the hotel was and he said about 30% capacity right now. So October is a perfect time to go if you dont want a big crowd. The beach was very nice and not so rocky like I read in some reviews. The room we had was ocean front with a spectacular view of the ocean. We got an upgrade since we got married there. Thanks Frank!!! The room was very big with a 32" inch lcd tv in it with about 100 channals. The bed was soooooooooooo comfy!!!! I layed on it most of the weekend and watch some sports while the wife layed out in the sun and got cooked. We ate after our wedding at a place they have there called the "La Capilla" Steakhouse. They had the best steak I ever had in my life! I had a 12oz sirloin, but they marinated it some sauce that was to die for! It was delicious! They only thing I didn't like was the water isn't free there. All they have is Fiji water bottles they will bring to your table and open and pour them for you.
reviews.title: Casamagna - Exceeded Expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Beach: OMG yes the beach and the water lived up to all the hype. The water is aqua like you see in the postcards yes its that clear and beautiful! I was so suprised when I saw it. You can even see it when your flying how clear and beautiful it is. Again like I said earlier the beach wasn't really rocky at all. There was plenty of sand and beach to lay out in or just play volleyball or some games. The water was very warm as expected, but it waves were pretty incredible! Even though the time we were there the beach had red flags out means basically swim at your own risk we had no problem swimming and getting our toes wet.
reviews.title: Awesome

likes.liked: — Pool area and swim up bar, great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Wedding: The wedding was so beautiful and perfect! We got married right on the beach in front of the ocean. Frank was our wedding planner and he did a great job with organizing and getting everything together. We never felt rushed or out of place. The Marriott CasaMagna is a wonderful and beautiful place to get married at!
reviews.title: My Favorite Hotel

likes.liked: — The views, the room, the beach.

reviews.text: Conclusion: All in all this is a wonderful and classy hotel with very friendly people that will go out of there way for you. Also this hotel is quite the bargain! We only paid $105.00 a night here. October is the best time to go if you want the beach to yourself and not wait an hour to get into any restaurant you want. We went to Planet Hollywood and Jimmy Buffetts Maragaritaville that weekend and didn't want 2 minutes either time. One was for lunch and the other was for dinner. Also, one last thing dont worry about the weather down there. If the weather channal says it's going to rain the whole time trust me it wont. It was forcasted for rain all that weekend and it rained 1 day for like 45 minutes then cleared right up and sunshine! Also if you get a chance take a day trip to "Isla Mujeres" the boat ride over there is alot of fun!!! The guys dress up, do kareokoe, and make you laugh your butt off and when the boat leaves at 9am the drinks are flowing all the way there and the way back!
reviews.title: watch out for the conventions
Wow...what a trip!!
reviews.text: My family and I returned from a wonderful 8 day stay at the Marriott Casa Magna yesterday. I worried and worried for 2 months that we had made the right choice for our family. I was a tripadvisor junkie, checking everyday for any new information. When we arrived on the 6th of June and was greeted by Jorge...or Georgie Porgie as he called himself with a big "Welcome Home", I knew that we were in the right place!!! We had a great ocean front room, 3095. The balcony was bigger than I expected and the view was phenominal. We did the Escape All-Inclusive package which worked well for our family. We didn't worry about money everytime the boys ordered food or drinks. My oldest had about 30 strawberry/Mango frozen drinks. They also had access to the boogie boards and floats by the pool. The restaurants were all great. Especially La Capilla...breakfast and dinner was wonderful. The young lady that works in the morning makes a mean omlette. We walked over to the JW to check it out and it is a beautiful hotel as well. The pool was more like a garden area and it entertwined throughout the property. While beautiful, we knew that with children we would be more comfortable at the Casa Magna because there weren't any places that we could lose them at the pool or the hot tub. They also had comfy pool and beach chairs that are different from the website pictures. They also replaced the outside dining chairs with brand new ones while we were there. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. I also recommend booking tours thru Boston Brant. Everything was on time and ran smoothly for us. We even left our stuff at home and he brought it by the hotel for us. That's service!!

We stayed at the Casa Magna from June 4th thru 12th. From the check in to check out, we felt at home. Check in only took about ten minutes. We got there at 1230 so they kept our bags while we had lunch. We got back about 2pm and our room was ready. We were in 'the best room available' according to the desk clerk. He was right!!! What a beautiful view.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: We also went to Champions Sports Bar while there. This was also great as Mexico was playing in world cup soccer at the time...alot of fun with many locals!!!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: There were alot more teens there (with a travel company) than I thought, but most were respectful and didn't get to out of hand.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel
Marriott is great, especially for kids!
reviews.text: I would recommend this Resort to anyone. We had a great and relaxing time.

We just came back from woderful stay of CasaMagna Marriott from June 20 to June 30, 2005. Our room was one of the oceanfront room with two double beds. The room has a big balcony with unobstructed view of beautiful ocean! The room was roomy and well decorated, with very comfortable down pillows and conforters. The room also has a minibar - but they charge almost $3 for a can of soda! We highly recommend to go to Wal-Mart and get drinks, snacks, and icechest. The taxi cost about $11 from Walmart to the Hotel, but it is worth to save money on food and drinks!
reviews.title: Will definately go back to Casamagna!

reviews.text: The hotel has a few restaurant - Champion is like a sport bar and Mikado specializes Japanese and Thai foods. Both places serve good quality food at reasonable price in Cancun Hotel Zone area, but they charge a lot of money for any drinks like other restaurants in Cancun. No refill for soft drinks!
reviews.title: Great Time!
Awesome Resort
reviews.text: The hotel staffs were very attentive and helpful. There were always staffs cleaning the property so the public area of the hotel was very clean. The water and ice are purified.

reviews.title: The Best Vacation Ever
reviews.text: We really had a great time staying at Casamagna and can't wait to go back again!

Just got back from a 5 night stay at Casa Magna (myself, husband, 13yr old son, 9 month daughter). We loved the room and beach sand and water were so beautiful. Casa Magna was the nicest beach we saw in that area and biggest. The staff was great and very accomodating. The food was good at Champions. And Cafe Salsa and the Italian restaurant at JW Marriott. We would stay here again if we ever go back to Cancun. Not too many teenagers mostly family and couples.
reviews.title: Very Nice!

reviews.text: My husband and I visited this hotel with 20 and 30 somethings that went for a wedding of a good friend. Some of us found the all inclusive available on Expedia.com and it really was worth it! The hotel is absolutely gorgeous! There is a swim up pool bar and we didn't find the beach bar until the last day, but UNDER the pool bar (you have to walk out to beach) there is a very nice beach bar with shade where you can eat and drink and watch the ocean.
reviews.title: HINT: Go All Inclusive!

reviews.text: The only problem was with check in. It may have been a new girl, but she could not find a room for us (we wanted to upgrade to partial ocean for $30 after SHE offered). When we accepted, she said it was not availabe, then she could not find us a king room, and then it was a mess! After pushing her she "happen" to find a partial view room for us. Then she argued with me that we were all inclusive until I showed her my paperwork. The bride and groom had the same problem- the man tellng them at the front desk that there were no other rooms (they were supposed to get a free upgrade) until she pushed and pushed, and low and behold, an ocean view suite opened up. So be pushy at the front desk if you have to be to get a great room- but be prepared to spend a little extra ($30/ night for partial, $50/night for full). However, the partial was exceptional and we were on the side of the building so we weren't looking at 50 other people on their balconies when we were outside. It was nice.
reviews.title: Best Beds Ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are VERY clean and nice.
reviews.title: Excelent stay at an excelent resort!

reviews.text: ALL INCLUSIVE!!!!!
reviews.title: I know this place gets glowing reviews but I'm not a fan - Here's why

likes.liked: — This place is Clean - Large Hi Definition TV - Beds comfortable
likes.disliked: — The hotel is located in the middle of nowhere. Beach is terrible. Pool small and boring !

reviews.text: This was such a great idea. The big deal here is the quality! We have been to all inclusive resorts before and the food shows that it is all inclusive. However, at the Casa Magna, hardley anyone is all inclusive (you have to really do some searching on expedia b/c they don't want spring breakers) so the food is prepared with quality and value b/c most people are paying big bucks for it. We had dinner one night in the steakhouse and the food was unbelievable! Although if you get surf and turf it is an extra $10.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel!!!

reviews.text: Imagine you decide to spend a little more in a good hotel. Choose a room with a partial view of the sea. The Hotel is beautiful and it is a Marriot. When you arrive at the reception, the front desk offers you an upgrade with full view of the sea. It would cost $ 59 instead of $ 100. You say no, and then he will make another proposal for $ 29. It sounds reliable? You go to the pool bar and notes that the domestic beer costs 60 pesos, you drink and when you ask to pay, the waiter charge you 70 pesos and it shows the value on the menu. You obviously think you are mistaken. The next day, you get the menu and the value of beer is 60 pesos. You call the bar manager and explain what happened. He just say: what can I do for you? How about excuse us? Reports to the general manager of the hotel in writing all the names of employees and you even get an apologize for reporting a problem. At check-out there are mini-bar charges that you did not have consumed. Internet for $ 15/day. Breakfast for about $ 25. Then, set up. What will you be paying much more than the offer attractive site.
reviews.title: Hotel with a very good physical structure, but needs to rethink the attitudes of staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an oceanfront room that had a balcony overlooking the sparkling blue pool and the gorgeous ocean. The view is absolutely what it looks like in the pictures you see of this resort. The staff is very VERY friendly and accommodating. I will say I wasn't entirely impressed with the woman that worked in the travel/excursions office, but she was helpful nonetheless.
reviews.title: Beautiful and Clean Resort

reviews.text: The Thai restaurant offers DELICIOUS meals, although all of the restaurants are a bit pricey (you will likely pay between $35-$50 for a meal for two, usually closer to $45 on average).
reviews.title: Nice stay!!!

reviews.text: As I mentioned in the title, the rooms are clean with tasteful decor. I was very pleased with our stay at this hotel.
reviews.title: Beautiful well appointed hotel

reviews.text: One word of advice to travelers to Cancun: if you find a bank OFF of the hotel's premises, you will pay considerably less withdrawal fees. Look for a bank to do any ATM transactions and DO NOT get money at the airport when you get off the plane. This is the biggest ripoff in terms of a crumby exchange rate. Wait until you get into town and can find an ATM that is from a particular BANK. Those that do not have a bank's name on them will likely also have higher transaction fees.
reviews.title: Can't imagine a better place

reviews.text: My wife and our daughter just got back from Cancun- I was there this past week June 12-19 this is our first time staying at this hotel. This hotel was simply fab.
reviews.title: Top-notch service.

reviews.text: Room: Above average balcony with amazing views. We were on the 3rd floor (there are 6 floors) so we were above the pool area. When we first arrived they gave us a garden view room that was ok but I up-grade to ocean front room. all the bathroom are the same size and the the same colord from garden view, ocean view, and ocean front, nothing different about it.
reviews.title: Almost 100% perfect

reviews.text: Food: Expensive for what it is. I am use to paying those prices becasue I live in NYC but I can see how it would add up quickly for a family. Breakfast was a buffet style but you had healthy choices, lunch was def overpriced for poolside ($3.50 for a can of soda!) and we never ate dinner at the hotel. Most of Cancun is overpriced (food wise) unless you go to fast food, which I never would, so just be prepared. People think Mexico is very cheap, but it's so Americanized that everything is geared towards the dollar.
reviews.title: Not for Me and My Family!
Wonderful Hotel
reviews.text: Atmosphere: The hotel is very large. The pool area is great with swim up bars and a nice beach area. The people are VERY friendly and you do NOT get bombarded with timeshare people.
Location: You can take the bus for $.65 and $1.00 bus that have air conditining to the clubs, bars, and restaurants from this hotel. Everything is so close or a very short bus ride away.
reviews.title: Absolutely loved it!

reviews.text: I was at the Casa Magna on a business conference for 4 days, what a wonderful surprise to find it was at such a lovely resort. No complaints, the service was first class, the food by the pool was delicious, the catering at the conference was beyond anyone's exception, delicious and tasted like we were in Mexico. Nothing generic about this resort.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort !

reviews.text: We had a great package deal that included daily breakfast, free wi-fi and 25% off all dining and spa treatments - and we took advantage of it all! The meals at the hotel as well as those at the J.W. Marriott next door were great. I certainly wasn't in Mexico for the food, but everything far exceeded my expectations and the staff at every meal was extremely friendly and attentive. The lobby is beautiful, the room was extremely comfortable with a beautiful ocean view and everyone working at the hotel went out of their way to make sure we were happy. The massage that I had at the spa was excellent as well. I would definitley stay here again and would highly recommend the hotel to anyone visiting Cancun.
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.text: I recently spent 10 nights at the CasaMagna for a conference and a day to play. I knew it would be a great trip but I had no idea how hard the CasaMagna staff would work to make it even better.
reviews.title: A dream come true

reviews.text: Each staff member went out of their way to welcome me or to see how I was doing. From people I only saw once, to those I saw each day. The room was fabulous---comfortable and with a lovely view. I fell asleep each night to the sound of the Caribbean.
reviews.title: Elegant and beautiful resort at affordable price

reviews.text: The food at the MANY onsite restaurants was beyond compare and the prices were very fair.
reviews.title: Vacations cancun

reviews.text: First time in Cancun and had a wonderful time. The Casa Magna is not the newest or the most luxurious but is very, very nice. The staff is very courteous, helpful, and friendly. The rooms are nice and the beds are the best I have found in a hotel at any price.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The JW Marriott which connects to the Casa Magna is a little more upscale but you can use either facilities restaurants, pool, beach, or public rooms. We are not lay on the beach or get in the water (heaven forbid) types so the skinny beach was not a problem.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel -- awesome service -- loved restaurants

reviews.text: This is a beautiful hotel. We walked over to the JW Marriott -- and personally liked what we saw better at the CasaMagna (granted, we did not see the JW's rooms). The view from all the Ocean View rooms looks great (the way the hotel is laid out is pretty cool). The rooms were VERY clean and the beds were great (slept so well).
reviews.title: Happy Surprise

reviews.text: All the staff were so helpful -- some of the best service we've ever had. The Japanese restaurant is very good, and the Italian restuarant at JW (Gustino's) is Excellent. Our concierge was so attentive and helpful.
reviews.title: Casamagn-aaahhhhhh.......

likes.liked: — Everything! It was beautiful and clean and the service was top notch!

reviews.text: They even gave us a late checkout (2 pm) for no charge.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience

likes.disliked: — The beach nothing the hotel can do but the gov is supposed to fix it soon

description: Discover Paradise. Powder soft sand and sparkling turquoise seas beckon travelers to the heart of the Mexican Caribbean and Marriott’s CasaMagna Cancun Resort. A legendary locale perfectly matched with Marriott’s commitment to service satisfies adventurous souls seeking to explore ruins or searching for serenity in the shadows of an ancient empire.
